snippet: Growing support for eliminating some of the tax breaks that high-income households get for charitable giving has some nonprofit groups worried.
abstract: Proposals to cap or otherwise limit deductions in order to raise tax revenue from the wealthy are gaining bipartisan support in Congress, and worrying charities and nonprofit groups; at stake is $300 billion that Americans donate to nonprofits annually, and $50 billion a year that tax deductions for charitable giving costs government.
lead_paragraph: Growing support for eliminating some of the tax breaks that high-income households get for charitable giving has some nonprofit groups worried.

headline.seo: Charities Press Congress to Save Tax Deductions
